page.title: 17KEMPSFORD FLYING FOX
page.content: Disappearing{public transport}caused a{community minibus}service in the { {Fairford}area, based at{Kempsford}to be started in 1984. Three circular trips operate on Tuesdays picking up around nine villages for shopping in { {Fairford.}On each Thursday there is a trip from different groups of villages to{Carterton}market. The County, District and Parish councils helped the initial funding of the 16 passenger, second hand bus from Stroud. The service is run entirely by volunteers. The fares are: adult- 20p. school children - 10p. The fare to Carterton is 50p.{"The Flying Fox"} with its bright yellow and green paintwork attracts attention but is not yet self supporting. It is available for hire at other times, making trips to{Bristol,Weston Super {Mare, London}and the{Oval Test Match.
